sequences.heading: Regions instead of countries
sequences.description: Sequence 1 focuses on regions instead of countries
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Autonomous regions that can govern themselves and maintain their unique cultural identity

sequences.heading: Regional policies
sequences.description: Sequence 2 focuses on regional policies
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Balanced distribution of settlements that preserves countryside while supporting urban vitality

sequences.heading: Major structures which define the city
sequences.description: Sequence 3 focuses on major structures which define the city
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Cities with clear identity and character formed by coherent underlying structures

sequences.heading: Communities and neighborhoods
sequences.description: Sequence 4 focuses on communities and neighborhoods
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Human-scale communities where people know each other and can participate in local governance

sequences.heading: Community networks
sequences.description: Sequence 5 focuses on community networks
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Connected networks that allow easy movement and communication while maintaining local character

sequences.heading: Character of local environments
sequences.description: Sequence 6 focuses on character of local environments
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Local environments that support human life and activity at the pedestrian scale

sequences.heading: Local centers
sequences.description: Sequence 7 focuses on local centers
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Vibrant centers that draw people together for commerce, culture, and social interaction

sequences.heading: Housing
sequences.description: Sequence 8 focuses on housing
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Diverse housing that accommodates different household types and life stages

sequences.heading: Work
sequences.description: Sequence 9 focuses on work
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Integration of work into the fabric of community life rather than segregated industrial zones

sequences.heading: Local road and path network
sequences.description: Sequence 10 focuses on local road and path network
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Path networks that prioritize pedestrians while accommodating necessary vehicle access

sequences.heading: Public open land
sequences.description: Sequence 11 focuses on public open land
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Public spaces that provide access to nature and opportunities for recreation and gathering

sequences.heading: Local common land
sequences.description: Sequence 12 focuses on local common land
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Common lands that strengthen community bonds and provide shared resources

sequences.heading: Transformation of the family
sequences.description: Sequence 13 focuses on transformation of the family
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Family structures that support child development and intergenerational connection

sequences.heading: Transformation of work and learning
sequences.description: Sequence 14 focuses on transformation of work and learning
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Learning and work environments that are integrated into community life

sequences.heading: Transformation of local shops and gathering places
sequences.description: Sequence 15 focuses on transformation of local shops and gathering places
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Local economies that provide for daily needs and social gathering within walking distance

sequences.heading: The overall arrangement of a group of buildings
sequences.description: Sequence 16 focuses on the overall arrangement of a group of buildings
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Building groups that create coherent outdoor spaces and support community interaction

sequences.heading: The position of individual buildings
sequences.description: Sequence 17 focuses on the position of individual buildings
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Individual buildings positioned to take advantage of site conditions and create good outdoor spaces

sequences.heading: Entrances, gardens, courtyards, roofs and terraces
sequences.description: Sequence 18 focuses on entrances, gardens, courtyards, roofs and terraces
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Transitions between inside and outside that extend the usable space and connect building to site

sequences.heading: Paths and squares
sequences.description: Sequence 19 focuses on paths and squares
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Pedestrian circulation that creates opportunities for encounter and makes spaces feel alive

sequences.heading: Gradients and connection of space
sequences.description: Sequence 20 focuses on gradients and connection of space
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Spatial sequences that create privacy gradients and support different types of activities

sequences.heading: The most important areas and rooms (in a house)
sequences.description: Sequence 21 focuses on the most important areas and rooms (in a house)
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Houses with clearly defined main areas that support family life and privacy

sequences.heading: The most important areas and rooms (in offices, workshops and public buildings)
sequences.description: Sequence 22 focuses on the most important areas and rooms (in offices, workshops and public buildings)
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Work buildings with spaces that support both individual work and group collaboration

sequences.heading: Outbuildings and access to the street and gardens
sequences.description: Sequence 23 focuses on outbuildings and access to the street and gardens
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Support buildings and connections that complete the building complex

sequences.heading: Knit the inside of the building to the outside
sequences.description: Sequence 24 focuses on knit the inside of the building to the outside
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Buildings that open to and engage with their surroundings rather than turning inward

sequences.heading: Arrange the gardens, and the places in the gardens
sequences.description: Sequence 25 focuses on arrange the gardens, and the places in the gardens
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Gardens that extend the life of the building and provide connection to nature

sequences.heading: Inside, attach necessary minor rooms and alcoves
sequences.description: Sequence 26 focuses on inside, attach necessary minor rooms and alcoves
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Secondary spaces that support the main activities without overwhelming them

sequences.heading: Fine tune the shape and size of rooms and alcoves
sequences.description: Sequence 27 focuses on fine tune the shape and size of rooms and alcoves
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Rooms shaped and sized to support their specific functions and create comfort

sequences.heading: Give the walls some depth
sequences.description: Sequence 28 focuses on give the walls some depth
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Walls with depth that provide storage, seating, and architectural richness

sequences.heading: Let the structure grow directly from your plans and your conception of the buildings
sequences.description: Sequence 29 focuses on let the structure grow directly from your plans and your conception of the buildings
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Structural systems that grow naturally from the spatial organization rather than imposing a grid

sequences.heading: Work out the complete structural layout
sequences.description: Sequence 30 focuses on work out the complete structural layout
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Coherent structural layouts that efficiently support the intended spatial arrangements

sequences.heading: Mark the column locations and erect the main frame
sequences.description: Sequence 31 focuses on mark the column locations and erect the main frame
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Primary structural framework that can support the intended building form and loads

sequences.heading: Fix the exact positions for openings and frame them
sequences.description: Sequence 32 focuses on fix the exact positions for openings and frame them
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Window and door openings positioned to support both structure and spatial quality

sequences.heading: Put in the following subsidiary patterns
sequences.description: Sequence 33 focuses on put in the following subsidiary patterns
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Secondary structural elements that complete the building system

sequences.heading: Put in the surfaces and indoor details
sequences.description: Sequence 34 focuses on put in the surfaces and indoor details
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Interior surfaces and details that create comfortable and beautiful interior spaces

sequences.heading: Build outdoor details
sequences.description: Sequence 35 focuses on build outdoor details
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Exterior details that connect the building to its immediate surroundings

sequences.heading: Complete the building
sequences.description: Sequence 36 focuses on complete the building
sequences.emergent_phenomena: Final elements that give the building its unique character and sense of completion
